Class PolyLinkedList

java.lang.Object
  datastrucandalgorithms.linkedlist.PolyLinkedList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class PolyLinkedList
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

A Linked List to manage Polynomials using PolyNodes

Author:
Brian Jerardi
Instructor:
Kendall Martin
Date:
10/02/2011
Course:
CIS 112
Assignment:
HW2 Chapter 4 problem 13 page 239

Constructor Detail

PolyLinkedList

public PolyLinkedList()
Initialize an empty list.

Parameters:
- - none
Postcondition:
This list is empty.

PolyLinkedList

public PolyLinkedList(double intialCoefficient)
Initialize a list with one PolyNode whose term is intialCoeffiecient x^0

Parameters:
intialCoefficient - The coefficient of the exponent 0
Postcondition:
This list contains one node whose term is intialCoeffiecient x^0 head, tail and lastAccessed are all set to this node

PolyLinkedList

public PolyLinkedList(PolyNode intialNode)
Initialize a list with one PolyNode

Parameters:
intialNode - The node to put into the list
Postcondition:
This list contains one node that is set to intialNode head, tail and lastAccessed are all set to this node
Method Detail

addNode

public void addNode(int exponent,
                    double coefficient)
Add a node to the list with the specified exponent and coefficient

Parameters:
exponent - The exponent to put into the added node
coefficient - The coefficient to put into the added node
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - exponent already exists in this list or negative
Precondition:
There is no node in the list with this exponent and exponent is positive
Postcondition:
A node has been created and put in order into the this list lastAccessed is set to this node

add_to_coef

public void add_to_coef(double amount,
                        int k)
Add an amount to the coefficient of the value at exponent k

Parameters:
amount - The amount to add to the coefficient
k - The exponent whose coefficient to add to
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no term at exponent k
Precondition:
A term exists with exponent k
Postcondition:
amount has been added to the coefficient at exponent k lastAcessed has been set to this node

assing_coef

public void assing_coef(double new_coefficient,
                        int k)
Assign a new coefficient to the term with exponent k

Parameters:
new_coefficient - The new coefficient to assign to the term
k - The exponent of the term to change
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no term at exponent k
Precondition:
A term exists with exponent k
Postcondition:
the coefficient at exponent k has been set to new_coefficient lastAcessed has been set to this node

clear

public void clear()
Clears the list by putting 0 into all of the existing terms coefficient

Parameters:
- - none
Postcondition:
All terms in this list have 0 coefficients

reserve

public void reserve(int degree)
Reserves space in this list by putting 0's into all coefficients up to degree that do not already have a term

Parameters:
degree - The degree to fill to
Postcondition:
term x^0 to x^degree exists and any that didn't already exist have coefficients of 0

coefficient

public double coefficient(int k)
Accessor method to get the coefficient with exponent k

Parameters:
k - the exponent of the term to find the coefficient of
Returns:
the coefficient of the term with exponent k
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - There is no term with exponent k
Precondition:
an exponent of k exists in this list

degree

public int degree()
Get the degree of this polynomial list

Returns:
The degree of this polynomial list -1 if the list is empty

next_term

public int next_term(int k)
Get the next term with a non-zero coefficient after the term with exponent k

Parameters:
k - The exponent of the term to start the search
Returns:
The first term with a non-zero coefficient after the term with exponent k
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - There is no term with exponent k
Precondition:
A node exists with the exponent k

eval

public double eval(double x)
Evaluate the polynomial for x = parameter x

Parameters:
x - The value to evaluate the polynomial for
Returns:
What the polynomial evaluates to with x = parameter x

derivative

public PolyLinkedList derivative(int n)
Get the n-th derivative of this polynomial

Parameters:
n - The number of derivatives to calculate
Returns:
the n-th derivative of this polynomial
Note:
Tip to use recursion from Nathon Aston
Postcondition:
The return value is the n-th derivative of this polynomial.

integral

Get the n-th integral of this polynomial

Parameters:
n - The number of integrals to calculate
Returns:
The n-th integral of this polynomial
Postcondition:
The return value is the n-th integral of this polynomial.

find_root

public double find_root(double starting_guess,
                        int maximum_iterations,
                        double epsilon)
Find the root of this polynomial

Parameters:
starting_guess - The starting guess of the root
maximum_iterations - The maximum times to try to find the root, if reached throws exception
epsilon - How close the absolute value of the polynomial must be for success
Returns:
The value that will make this polynomial evaluate epsilon close to 0
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The maximum iterations was reached, or Flat Failure occurred
